title: Does everyone write their wedding vows in the U.S.? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sorry, and no, not everyone in the U.S. writes their own wedding vows. Myself and other Wonderful Wedding Officiants, can and usually do help with the full wedding ceremony and the wedding vows. Some couples leave the ceremony and vows as written, some alter where they want and others have newer ideas and those ideas are always welcome. Some people freeze when attempting to write out their heartfelt emotions. Others can’t stop writing and everything in between. When appropriate your Officiant is there to help. There are many beautiful and not so pretty wedding vows available on the internet. We may not want to plagiarize, so we’ll use those pre-written vows to inspire our own. Borrow from other’s, writings, poetry, movies, books, TV and such. Talk to family and friends and listen to their comments. Choose what you want. The possibilities are endless. I, as, I’m fairly certain, other officiants are, wanting to avoid, what you, the couple, does not want and include what you do. After all, it’s your wedding, ought be done your way . . . So, you see, not everyone In the US writes their own vows and some do. You may write me, for a free eCopy, of an excerpt (while supplies last), of the soon to be released, “Wedding Ceremonies With Beautiful Vows for Inspiration and Adoption.” Have a wonderful wedding and a joyous marriage. Take good care . . .
Does everyone write their wedding vows in the U.S.? No. Most of us just use whatever the officiant provides.
